column4: whats the difference between the ubuntu install and the ubuntu live
http://public.planetmirror.com/pub/ubuntu/releases/5.10/ <--- from that
so whats the point of having 2 different types..?
nope
i'm new to the whole linux stuff
i just heard ubuntu is win
win as in good
: the live cd allows you to try out ubuntu before you install it
- how long did it take for you?
: it took exactly 4 weeks
: from a newbie point of view packages are additional software
- so how do I run windows applications/games/etc on a linux based system?
: I use a emulator called wine
: it works for me
I really don't see any real difference...I mean I use wine for a fixed number of applications that I must use and it works perfectly
but I am not a gamer and there maybe something better for games
in the linux world all those things you would normally have to install already come with ubuntu like office software
: I have been running ubuntu now as a test for 68 days without a reboot and with very little problems...this is the most unbroken linux I have used thus so far
- i see, sounds good.
and yes..unlike windows that really will not make any use of the gig of ram you have...ubuntu uses it...my machine flies
- haha, i only have 512mb :|
believe it or not windows doesn't use all that ram...reports it does but does not in reality...ubuntu will
: stick with ubuntu
